sections.COMMAND AND SIGNAL:
OIC: 1LT Ryer Barnes
NCOIC: SFC Jon Williams
RSO: SSG Abell
Safeties: TBD
P-TSM
A-FM
C-PORTABLE PHONE
E-RUNNER
2.
sections.MISSION: A TROOP, 1/2 CR conducts M4 Qualification on 24 JUL 23 on Range 126 IOT train and qualify Soldiers on the M4 weapon system.
sections.PURPOSE: – In order to produce Soldiers that are qualified on the M4 weapon system.
sections.KEY TASKS:
–
Train Lethal Soldiers
Build Confidence in assigned weapon system
Soldiers receiver an opportunity to qualify at night.
sections.END STATE:
– All of the Troop’s Soldiers qualified on M4 weapon system, improving TRP/SQDN lethality. Troop Commander and Platoon Leaders are presented with list of qualified soldiers.
3.
sections.EXECUTION:
PLTs will conduct round-robin Tables I-III days prior to range. On day of range troop moves to RG 126 assembles in AA. Firers move dismounted to holding area at RG 126, receive range and safety brief, receive ammo at 126.
Tables IV-VI will be conducted 24 JUL 23.
Table IV will be conducted in two parts, the group/zero and the known distance confirmation on Ranges 126. Lanes on range 126 will transition to Table V when it is deemed there are enough Soldiers to start Table V. We will make the transition to Table VI when appropriate.
C I – AMA, Water Internal to PLT.
C IV – Sandbags through Range Control.
C V – Ammunition coordinated by XO.
Task to Subordinate Units-
HQ – Provide overall C2 support and Coordinate field rations.
1st PLT – 3x Safeties, Table III
2nd PLT - 3x Safeties, 6x fire detail, Table I
3rd PLT – 2x Safeties, 1x OIC, 1xRSO, 1xRTO, 1x Ammo NCO, 2x Soldiers for ammo detail, Medical Support, 2x Gate Guards Table II
sections.COORDINATING INSTRUCTIONS:
-
Zeroing and Grouping will be completed in slick uniform. All other events will be completed in full Dragoon Standard
Platoons will coordinate their own transportation to the range. Ensure Soldiers are utilizing the concurrent training that will be explained in the range orientation
4.

values: SAFETY BRIEF, PCC/ PCI/CHOKE POINT AT ASP
SOLDIERS WILL USE SELECTOR SWITCH DISCIPLINE AND ONLY PLACE THE WEAPON SYSTEM ON FIRE PRIOR TO ENGAGING TARGETS.
UPON COMPLETION OF EACH ENGAGEMENT, SELECTOR SWITCHES WILL BE PLACED ON SAFE.

subtasks.hazard: RICHOCHET, WEAPON ORIENTED OTHER THAN DOWNRANGE

values: FULL DRAGOON STANDARD WORN WHEN ON THE FIRING LINE DURING EXECUTION OF M4 QUAL.
SOLDIERS BRIEFED REGARDING BOTH POSSIBILILITY OF RICHOCHET AND IMPORTANCE OF MAINTAINING MUZZLE DISCIPLINE.
SAFETY BRIEF, RANGE CONSTRUCTION, SPOT CHECKS
ANY SOLDIER WHO IDENTIFIES WILDLIFE ON THE RANGE DURING LIVE FIRE WILL IMMEDIETLY CALL CEASE FIRE
IMMEDIATE ACTION WILL BE PERFORMED, FOLLOWED BY REMEDIAL. AFTER REMEDIAL ACTION, LEVEL 20 ARMORERS ON-SITE WILL CHECK THE WEAPON.
SMs will only shoot at targets inside of the designated SDZs.

subtasks.hazard: COLLISIONS WITH MILITARY OR CIVILIAN MOTOR VEHICLES

values: A TRP WILL MOVE IN PLATOON SIZED ELEMENTS IOT MINIMIZE THE POSSIBILITY OF COLLISIONS.
EACH VEHICLE WILL HAVE AN FM RADIO AND ADHERE TO 50-100 m INTERVALS BETWEEN VEHICLES.
WILL ADHERE TO SQDN SOP REGARDING VC AND REAR GUARD AWARENESS.

subtask.name: RANGE PROXIMITY TO SAHA BLAST RADIUS

subtasks.hazard: IN EVENT OF UNWARRANTED/ACCIDENTAL EXPLOSIONS, RG 126 IS WITHIN THE RADIUS OF THE SAHA BLAST RADIUS

values: RISK TO FORCE AND MITIGATION CONTROL FACTORS WILL BE BRIEFED DURING SAFETY BRIEF
IN EVENT OF CATASTROPHIC EXPLOSION AT NAHA, RSO/BEACHMASTER WILL MOVE FIRERS TO DEFALADE AREA AND BEHIND COVER AND ENSURE SOLDIERS ARE LOCATED BEHIND COVER/IN PRONE

draw.overall_supervision_plan: Safety brief to be conducted by RSO and will cover range orientation, procedures from ammo point to the firing line, actions on the firing line, and clearance procedures.
